lines.text:
[Indignantly to the barber]
My head comes off as it is!

[Noticing that Bonet and Picard are handcuffed]
Oh! Oh, which one of you gentlemen is the prisoner?
Ah. of course! A bad type! What did he do?
I killed a conducter for asking too many questions.
[the conductor nervously makes a quick exit]
Martyrs are fools who die because they want to. My son wants to live!

[to Bonet]
I suppose there's a time when any man, even a man like me, can find something... something bigger than himself for which he is willing to die without question, almost... almost happily.

[Last lines]
What is he really like, deep in his heart?

[Sitting outside a church with Bonet urging him to go inside]
Look, Bonet, inside that church is a nice simple village priest. What confessions is he used to? Petty stuff. Swearing, drinking, beating your wife - things like that. Why, if he heard my list he'd faint. For me it'd take at least a bishop.
